Compressed Gas & .50 caliber rifles

Months before, 10 teams of two men set shop in mid-sized cities (apx.population 400,000 – 800,000) and observe the railroad and truck shipments of compressed gasses. Once the planning is complete and targets of opportunity are identified, the teams disperse. From then on each man operates individually and has no further contact with the other.

Each man must obtain a .50 caliber rifle on their own, but ammunition is given to all at the outset. To minimize suspicion, they must take on the persona of a stereotypical pro-America avid gun-enthusiast — including purchasing several small arms and making regular trips to firing ranges.

On the given day, each man is to strike between 8:00 and 8:10 am to minimize federal recognition and response to a mulitple-threat attack. Armed with a .50 caliber rifle and a 2-4 Raufoss multi-purpose rounds, they shoot tankers of compressed gas — preferrably in-or-near major soft targets like hospitals, schools, apartments, etc. or key infrastructure like highway interchanges, electric sub-stations, etc.

RESULTS:
Cities in which two flammable targets are hit will overwhelm the capabilities of fire departments from these mid-sized cities. Cities in which one toxic gas and one flammable target are hit will slow the initial response to give the fire a chance to spread. Cities in which two toxic gas targets are hit will cause chaos as conflicting reports of gas type and source come in.

NOTES:
* Raufoss multi-purpose rounds combines armor-piercing, explosive, and incendiary effects for maximum anti-personnel and fire start effect.

Pat Sutlaw ‚Ä¢ April 24, 2006 5:43 PM

If you really want to make an impression on the American nation, the way to do it is to sink an aircraft carrier. Better still, sink an aircraft carrier and make a video of the attack for propaganda.
Now on the face of it, knocking out a carrier is difficult, but I think there might be a small chance as follows:

A. Analyse global carrier delpoyments to work out where they regularly pass through shallow waters. Bottlenecks such as the Straights of Gibraltar or the approach channels to any harbours regularly used by carriers might be candidates. The point is to find a relatively shallow stretch of water where a carrier is likely to go, sooner or later.

B. Upon confirmation of an approaching carrier, Sink a large quantity of compressed LPG gas cylinders, clad in explosive designed to rupture the gas cylinders, in the expected path of the carrier. What is a “large quantity”? Well I am thinking of (say) 500 47kg propane cylinders giving 23,500kg compressed gas. The gas will expand by a factor of 250 when released (http://www.lpga.co.uk/fr_ab_lp.htm).

C. When the carrier is sailing over the sunk gas cylinders detonate the explosives to release the compressed gas. Note that we are not interested in the potential explosive force of the gas when detonated in oxygen – we just want to release as much gas as possible under the ship to force it down in the water.

A few notes:

  1. Perhaps you don’t “get” this. Normal ship buoyancy relies on the weight of displaced water by a ship. If the water under the ship contains enough rising gas, then the ship will sink. The only question is how much gas is required to achieve this result.
  2. If the attack is carried out on a ship approaching a harbour, there should be a chance to get the attack on video.
  3. As far as I know, no warship has ever been designed to defend against this type of attack. The only possible defence I can see is to keep the ship sealed airtight so that it will float back up after the gas has bubbled up to the surface.
  4. LPG has been suggested because it is easily commercially available. There may be other compressed gases, such as normal air, that have better liquid/gas compression ratios and hence are more suitable for this type of attack.

  5. Buying enough LPG gas to achieve this aim would be very expensive today. Perhaps a bit of old-fashioned fraud or even theft would be better than purachsing the gas (after all who wil look for it underwater).

  6. Reliably blowing up the gas cylinders under (say) several hundred feet of water would be hard. The only chance I see is a command line laid from the sunk gas to a control point. This is definitely a weak point in the attack.

Just to clear up any potential misunderstandings, I have no interest in terrorism – just security.

Here’s one for you Bruce:

A group of 30 terrorists splits into small teams, with each team deployed in a major metropolitan area. Since the movie needs high-tech, we can show them keeping in touch via e-mail using nearly-unbreakable cryptography based on biometrics (i.e., they all have laptops with fingerprint scanners).

At a prearranged time, part of each team quietly infiltrates mass-transit buses headed toward shopping malls. The terrorist replaces the driver at the depot before the bus leaves, so the passengers have no idea what’s going on. The remainder of each team purchases/steals/makes armed-mall-security-guard uniforms and slips into each mall.

The driver (wearning an explosive vest of course) drives into the mall through a large, plate-glass window and detonates the vest, sending a diesel fireball into the surrounding crowd, incinerating the bus and all passengers. On cue, the disguised fake guards open fire on the screaming crowd, causing further panic, confusion, and loss of life. This is repeated in the 10 largest malls across the country. The country grinds to a halt as panic ensues — Americans no longer trust public transportation (and, by extension, taxis), they fear police and security guards, and refuse to go shopping.

If we need a happy ending, we can have a sexy FBI agent and a bookish-yet-handsome male counterpart find one of the laptops and lift a terrorist’s fingerprint from a bathroom mirror. They break the encryption at the last minute and manage to save the Mall of America before the final attack is completed. The final scene ends with the fake guards being gunned-down by Mel Gibson (backed by a SWAT team spraying bullets into the perfume section at Macy’s) while the tires on the bus are shot out by a military attack helicopter, with the impact knocking the terrorist out cold. The passengers all survive and are safely taken off the bus, just as the terrorist wakes up and detonates his bomb.

paul ‚Ä¢ April 25, 2006 5:48 AM

First, pick a number of people from the telephone book, and case them to determine their appearance and routine. When you are ready, submit the list to a major newspaper in the area identifying who will be killed.

I see three possible responses from the potential victims, they will attempt to flee, they will seek the protection of the police, or they will ignore the threat.

Those that ignore the threat will be easy targets, they can be killed by blowing up their house, sniping them at work, etc.

Those that attempt to flee will have to be followed. Most likely, they will go to family or friends, in which case, it is most effective to kill whoever they flee to as well. Of course, collateral damage would be desirable, but not essential.

Those that seek police protection would require something like a suicide car bomb (with a timer on the bomb in case the bomber is shot through the head), or storming the location with machine guns and RPG’s. If the victims were able to seek military protection on a base, then a terrorist would get a job at the base, and use something like ricin in an umbrella tip to kill the victim. After all, collateral damage is not as important as getting every victim.

Nocturn ‚Ä¢ April 25, 2006 6:11 AM

My movie plot has a nice twist to it in that it does have a big impact but without causing many physical casualties.

The assault focusses on a multi-vector attack on two primary targets, ammended by some decoys (to divert attention).

The primary targets are both the national bank and the stock market. As decoys, 2 major US banks are selected. Two teams of 5 people get fake credentials that allow them to penetrate the infrastructure of the decoy targets (the banks). The real target is their IT infrastructure, so there may be a backdoor to get them in through external IT suppliers or management/backup firms. We do not need to hit these very hard as the target is to grab attention.
The infiltration attempts to gain enough access to nock out the bank computers for at least 1 day, a nice bonus is to get their ATM systems down too.

For the primary targets, a lot of preparation and recon is needed. The objective is to disable or at least permanently cripple them.
Each target is assigned a team of 10 people, a good proportion of funding is used in providing them with fake backgrounds, IT and financial training and in selecting and hiring black hat hackers and rogue financial consultants and to purchase information.

After the initial recon and armed with technical details about the working of the IT infrastructure, our infiltrants start to penetrate both organisations. Secondly, a team of our people and hired blackhats start working on a very specific computer virus to attack our targets digitally.

Subteams for the primary targets find out information about the physical layout of the computer infrastructure for the targets, including datacenter location and backup centers. They infiltrate as far as possible to get access to them, or at least get near to them.

On the big day, very early in the morning (think 05:00 or 06:00), the decoys get attacked knocking most of the bank infrastructure offline. This can be by physically blowing up power relays or networking hubs or electronicly or a combination of both. The objective is to disrupt, not to destroy.

In the subsequent (still mild) chaos, a digital attack (our virus) targets the stock market shortly after opening and the national bank. This will disrupt financial transactions quite quickly.
When the chaos of both previous events is coming into effect, the infiltration teams start their work targetting in parallel the datacenters and their backups of the primary targets. The idea here is no longer to cause disruptions, but to actually destroy the equipment beyond repair. They more damage, the better for the attack scenario.

Though this attack causes little physical damage compared to other, more spectacular attacks, it will have a profound effect on a country like the US that is dependent on its corporations and corporations work largely based on the stock market and the financial market.
By striking both at once, trading will at least come to a temporary halt and maybe even permanently. With all this data lost or at least inaccessible for a long time, a lot of corporations will fail, resulting in a cascading failure on the economy.

Richard ‚Ä¢ April 25, 2006 11:41 AM

Speaking as a UK citizen, some of the most awful terrorist attacks that we have suffered involved smallish home-made bombs placed in an ordinary high street. Think of the Omagh bomb for example. These things don’t necessarily require a lot of money to organise.

So, my terrorist plot would be to make 50 smallish home-made bombs and place each in a car parked on the street of a small to moderate sized town in each of the US states. No high profile targets, just ordinary towns where ordinary people go about their lives. Then the terrorists would detonate each bomb one after the other, ideally picking a part of the day in each state or timezone when the streets would be busiest.

The result would be death and injury across the country. You’d get a sense of the authorities being unable to cope with the spread of attacks. The media would spend the initial period after the bombs dashing from one place to another in an effort to cover the story. This would increase the sense of dislocation and confusion.

Those hurt would not be living or working in high-profile targets. So the resultant sense would be that nowhere is safe – maximum terror. An added bonus would be that the government would probably panic and introduce all sorts of pervasive repressive liberty-curtailing legislation, increasing the levels of fear in society and further undermining the American way of life.

If the terrorists could recruit some disaffected American young men as part of the group that would be even more effective. As it would lead to American suspecting American everywhere they go. In fact, I’m scaring myself as I write this…

jmr ‚Ä¢ April 25, 2006 2:40 PM

How about this one:

Terrorists undertake training to fly airplanes. (Like that’s never happened before.) They plot to take over cargo jets by, get this, shipping themselves via UPS or Fedex. Once on the airplanes, inside boxes, they cut themselves free, and storm the cockpit. From here, it’s pick-your-target time. White House, Super Bowl, Sky Scrapers, whatever.

For planning, they need to determine the routes that the air carriers send packages via. So, they send numerous packages with altimeters in them. Those that reach > 3000 feet (and aren’t destined for Denver) are assumed to be sent via air. (GPS won’t work because of the surrounding airplane and cargo.)

Then, having determined the methods of sending packages that guarantee boarding airplanes, they label their cargo as biological (thus guaranteeing it is pressurized) or enclose an oxygen supply. They sit and wait, watching their altimeters, until finally the moment arrives, and they exit their confines to take over the planes, using guns which they carried on their persons, and torches to cut through any security measures on the doors (if any).

They coordinate with other planes via satellite phone, and when the time is right, they plow their aircraft into interesting targets. Large dams, stadiums with people in them, maybe the Empire State Building (which will probably survive, but the point is to make a statement). Definitely the White House and Capitol Building. Maybe a few crowded airport terminals, just to be thorough.

I figure they can take down ten or twenty targets given enough participants, and instead of having to deal with planes full of people they only have to deal with small flight crews. The availability of guns on cargo flights makes it possible to use only one or two terrorists per flight, thus permitting many simultaneous captures.

ChemGuy ‚Ä¢ April 25, 2006 3:32 PM

The Poisoners

In preparation the four smartest terrorists are sent to good universities outside of the US. Three study chemical engineering with a focus on synthesis, and one studies toxicology. Cost: $200,000. They return to their homeland to begin the execution of their plan in earnest.

The first stage of the plan takes place in Iran, backwoods Pakistan, or any other place where the terrorists can operate and train with relative impunity. The build a modern chemical synthesis lab and begin producing highly toxic poisons (e.g. saxitoxin, ricin, mustard gas, etc).These are all fairly easy to produce with inexpensive supplies and standard university training. Cost : $100,000

Stage two involves the entire team getting into the US with a stockpile of poison. The poison is easily concealed and a few kilograms would be enough for the mission. We’ll allocate $100,000 for smuggling costs to make sure we get it right.

Next the team gets transport and spilts up, traveling to mid to large size cities across the continental US. On a prearranged schedule the members go around to grocery stores with fine syringes, poisoning a specific type of food each week. One week it is cheese, the next week bacon. If poeple begin turning to delivery groceries hijack delivery trucks and poison everything inside before delivery.

After a while grocery store security is too tight and team members start to get caught. At this point the remiaing members switch to gas attacks targeting the air intakes of large buildings. Often you only need to get to the roof to get access to these systems. More team members get caught, leading to the final operation involving poisoning the water supply of mid-size or small towns, one by one until each terrorist is caught.

The advantages of this plan are that everyone has to eat, so targeting normal food produces a very powerful fear. In addition, many foods can be poisoned without tell-tale signs of tampering, allowing you to target a lot of people at very low risk. Every Arab in America has to go to the grocery store sometime, so profiling will give so many false leads as to be useless. Poison gas is also incredibly scary, mostly because ordinary people have no defense against it. Finally, poison water can cause the largest amount of casualities.

Geoff Lane ‚Ä¢ April 25, 2006 3:49 PM

A Summer Sunday, early evening.
All around the city 25 pairs of terrorists are completing their
preparations. Each pair has a large, stolen four-wheel drive car internally
fitted with home made armour. Into the car they have packed a large number
of grenades, guns and ammo and a large suicide charge with a timer which
will eventually cause an explosion should it not be triggered by a
terrorist. The terrorists perform a final check, put on their army surplus
body protection and helmets. They are ready.

Same day, one hour later.
The terrorists have moved to their initial positions and are listening to
the radio. They are calm and do not talk. Each has said goodbye to their
family and friends in letters and videos that will be delivered on Monday
morning. The music on the radio ends and the news starts. It is time to
go. Their routes are all similar, starting at the edge of the city they will
each travel through populated areas and converge on the central target. If
any pair survives the journey, which is only three miles or so, they attack
the final objective. There is no intention that any of them should survive
the next 15 minutes.

Five minutes later.
Each vehicle is positioned at the start its route. Guns are checked. Seat
belts are tightened. Helmets are put on. It’s quiet, not much traffic. The
sun is setting. People are walking, enjoying the pleasant evening. Outside
coffee shops there are tables and chairs full of chatting customers. There
are queues at the movie houses. There is no hurry, driving at 30 miles an
hour it will take less than 10 minutes to reach the target.

The first minute of the attack was the most deadly, nobody was aware what
was happening as the world exploded around them. A couple of grenades fired
into a coffee shop kills or wounds fifty people and sets fire to the
building. Automatic gun fire directed at a movie queue kills at least a
hundred people in 10 seconds. Around the city 10,000 people are killed or
wounded before the first panic phone call is received by the police.

A minute later.
Two of the terrorist cars are stopped by head on collisions with other cars
driven by brave, but now dead, drivers. Through the steam from the radiators
the terrorists make their stand. When all their grenades and ammo is gone
they explode the suicide charge. One of the explosions brings down an old
building blocking the road; by bad luck it isolates one of the largest ER
hospitals in the city.

A minute later.
Another pair of terrorists is dead, a grenade misfire killed the pair and
the car crashed into shop front. In 15 minutes it will explode, destroying
the building and killing a large number of people crowding round to see what
they could see.

A minute later.
The police are now activated in force, but it’s a Sunday and there are just
not many immediately available. There are frantic efforts to get a general
warning broadcast on the local radio but nobody at the radio station is
answering the phone — the system is now automated and run over cables from
a town 120 miles away and nobody can find the phone number. An old beat cop
finally remembers the air attack warning system from the 1950s and shoots
off the rusted locks from the box containing the switch. A mornfull wail
starts throughout the city, but will anybody understand its meaning?

A minute later.
Human targets are now few and far between. Most people have moved off the
main streets but there is a lot of mostly ineffective small arms fire from
buildings. Lucky shots take out the tires of five terrorist vehicles which
slows them down a little. The stream of reports to the police is now
massive, overwhelming, but a pattern is emerging which allows a plot to be
made on the city map and so the final objective is now obvious.

A minute later.
The lack of human targets allows the terrorists to speed up and they are
almost in sight of their target. But by now the police are putting the
major ground attack defence plan into action. Remotely controlled road
blocks are activated and many of them operate as planned, raising bollards
from the road surface to stop traffic. Police and military stationed within
the central part of the city have reached their emergency stations and have
set up RPG launchers in killing areas around the final objective. As each
of the terrorist cars reaches a set of bollards, a second set are raised
behind them, trapping them and they are killed with RPGs. Unfortunately
some of the terrorists set off their suicide bombs and some are triggered by
the RPGs. Some explode a few minutes later when the timers trigger them.

A minute later.
All the terrorists are dead. Total casualties approach 15,000. Large parts
of the city are alight. The hospitals are overwhelmed.

Ten minutes later.
Six of the remaining terrorist cars explode destroying or damaging many
building.

Last Scene.

The old beat cop is standing in a road. As the camera pans around from his
face we see what he sees. Collapsed buildings, fires, emergency vehicles as
far as the eye can see.

If possible the old beat cop should be played by Sean Connery.

monta ‚Ä¢ April 25, 2006 3:56 PM

Bruce Schneier’s Terrorist movie plots contest.
How to do the most damage to the U.S. with 30 people and $500,000.

Everyone is afraid of burning to death (at least the people that I’ve asked are üòâ )

This plot requires primarily a small set of tanks used for an oxyacetylene torch welding; and perhaps a trash can for each of 30 terrorists. (The other $400,000 can be used as a reward to the families of the terrorists as a recruitment bonus).

It Begins with a spark.

At 3:00 a.m. in the morning on a weekday, the terrorist shows up at a high rise hotel with his oxyacetylene torch tanks hidden in a standard, plastic, rolling 30 gallon garbage can. Dressed as a maintenance worker he approaches the rear door. Lighting the torch he welds a small bead between the metal door and metal door frame. The process takes less than 5 minutes and the door subsequently resists any “unarmed” human attempt at opening it. He walks around to the other rear and side doors, welding each of them shut. The whole process has taken under half an hour while virtually everyone was asleep. He makes his way to the front of the building. He quickly dumps his load of kerosene soaked wood and paper out of his trash can, and into the lobby; probably on the nearby couches, chairs, or the wooden main desk. He lights it with the torch. He hangs the torch on the tank with the flame directed at the oxygen tank. He leaves the torch in the already burning lobby while he makes his hasty exit.

The hotel staff of 2, awake in the lobby in the wee morning hours, make it out without life threatening burns after pulling a fire call-box. The fire alarms go off. The kerosene soaked materials quickly grow into large flames. In minutes most of the occupants have woken from their slumber, got their bearings and are stampeding to the exits. (The complacent and sound sleepers die will soon die in their rooms). The ones reaching the front door encounter the flames and turn around and head toward the rear where people are already piling up behind the rear doors- welded shut. Some kids are crushed- lifeless in onslaught, long before the toxic smoke reaches the area to suffocate the remainder. The sprinkler is triggered and the flames are retarded somewhat until the oxygen tank, finally cut by the still active torch, explodes. The resulting oxygen in the already flaming room triggers a fuel/air type explosion; killing all those in the immediate vicinity- (many of which were still heading towards the front door.) The resulting ball of fire ignites the walls and other materials away from and overwhelming the spray from the sprinklers also triggered by the explosion.

Firefighters

When firefighters eventually arrive the front entrance is hopeless; scores are dead and hundreds are dying. Nearly a thousand total die from flames and toxic smoke while the fire fighters spend precious minutes using the jaws of life, and even axes to beat open the doors that have been welded closed. Although the ingenious firefighters opened the doors within a handful of minutes of arriving, the damages has already been done. For the majority of the people trapped inside to have a chance of surviving they should have exited the building under their own power long before the first fire truck arrived. The firemen enter, climbing over the bodies of the crushed and asphyxiated near the doors looking for those remaining few that have a chance of survival.

The Toll

Repeat this scene 30 times simultaneously across the U.S. on one night. Assume 5 of the 30 are caught and stopped by inquisitive night-time hotel staff before the deed is done. (A very generous estimate). Also assume the remaining 25 fires kill 800 people on average for a death toll of 20,000 mostly business travelers– it was a week day after all. (Over six times the deaths from the 9/11 attacks).

Lather; Rinse; Repeat

Disappear for a few days, allowing people to loose a little vigilance- but re-appear before security guards can be hired at all hotels. Repeat the process. Once again there are over 10,000 dead in the United States. In the media, bedlam ensues, equivalent to the fuel/air explosions in the lobbies of the doomed motels.

Tourism stops. Business travels refuse to travel. The travel and tourism industry collapses while any business with traveling sales, or engineering teams (or the like) become incredibly less efficient. No five minute period can pass without overhearing talk and wild speculation about the terrorists, from the radio, T.V., chain e-mails, and passers-by.

“Productive” employers are robbed wholesale by security companies trying to hire enough staff to watch every motel 24×7 if not every door. The President declares a state of emergency. The national guard is recalled from Iraq to protect the homeland.

Change targets:

Melt away again for a few days- the remaining 10 terrorists or so, yet uncaught, attack (for variety) nursing homes, hospitals, and college dormitories. Thousands and thousands die yet again. All Universities are immediately closed by Presidential Order until such time as the state of emergency is declared to be over. The Army is recalled from Iraq to protect the hospitals and nursing homes. People refuse to leave their homes overnight for any reason. Conferences and business meetings are canceled nationwide. Terrorist cells grow quickly in the vacuum left in Iraq…

Aftermath:

The disruption to “business as usual” causes a similar disruption in the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) that begins a long slide from inflation (due to the initial increase costs of doing business) to depression. Final tally: 45,000 dead; 100,000,000 unemployed and a population scared senseless.

Shawn W ‚Ä¢ April 25, 2006 4:59 PM

A computer virus that automatically sends itself to everyone in your address book is modified to be transmitted over cell phones. When it infects a phone, it automatically sends the virus via data transfer to every phone in the phone book, and so on, until within minutes, every cell phone that allows data transfer (almost all) in the world is infected without anyone realizing. A time release causes all phone books to be erased at the exact same moment across the world, and all phones to be rendered useless. With communication, commerce, the stock market, and nearly every business essentially crippled temporarily, terrorists communicating through old analog phones take advantage of panicked worldwide stock markets in the minutes after the attack before they are closed, and make themselves billions to fund future attacks. And that’s only the first 20 minutes of the movie…

Mark ‚Ä¢ April 25, 2006 7:16 PM

simple, yet highly effective and terribly difficult to prevent:

the movie opens with our average joe leaving the campus of a local college and heading into walmart. there, he buys a nice hunting rifle (showing his ID to prove that he is over 18 years of age, of course). he walks outside and up to the top of a hill, where he sets up a video camera and begins to record his hands. through the video camera, we see him pull from his backpack some symbolic bullet (i dunno – make it red or something “cinematic”) that is carefully wrapped in “bad guy” symbolism. after a careful ritual we watch the bullet chambered into the guy and the video camera is swiveled and zooms into the city below him, where innocent people are walking and performing their daily duties. suddenly, a shot rings out and one of the people in the viewfinder drop to the ground, dead.

the tape ends up on the internet within the hour.

and this is the first.

hundreds of miles away, a similar scenarios is playing out in another town. another camera – another single shot. another video posted to the internet within the hour.

within the next few days, 8 more single shots ring out across the country, never in the same town. 8 more unsuspecting people killed. the terror that occured in DC a few years ago is exponentially higher as the entire country is gripped in terror; unable to go outside, lest they become targets.

the FBI cannot follow every lead and cannot protect everyone, so vigilante groups are formed in small towns and across the nation.

copycat murderers begin popping up in other places, which throw off investigations (i am sure that we could have the FBI catch one to build drama and extend the movie to full-length).

every one of the 20-30 individuals in our “bad guy” group only fires one shot and then destroys the weapon, the camera, and all evidence of the act. these random killings are nearly impossible to track and noone is ever caught.

eventually, all of our bad guys have taken one shot and move out of the country.

the movie ends when our average joe graduates from college and as he is leaving, meets another average joe (from his country, or from somewhere that he knows) and as they shake hands, they pass the knowing smile and we see that the whole cycle is just starting again…

a great movie plot that is entirely feasible and done well within the allotted budget…

The fault with a large scale, high publicity terrorist attack is it won’t destroy a country, it only brings it together as 9/11 did. Sure new policies and rules were implemented, but to tear a nation apart people need to be paranoid, they need to fear their next door neighbor.

So whoever these would be terrorists are, they need to infiltrate the residential areas, the nice communities in the suburbs where all the houses are clones of each other. Now of course they can’t simply buy the house and gain everyone’s trust just to turn around and start attacking. They’ll need to get already established people, the type that have been there for a good ten to twenty years. Now some ways to “persuade” them into joining are many, such as money, a new start, or threatening loved ones. They’re terrorist, they’ll find a way.

Once they have the average Joe recruited, this new operative will either plant or wear a bomb in a public, “safe” location, such as a Wal-Mart or shopping mall. Them boom! But the trick here is not to keep this person’s identity secret. The terrorists could have planted a note by the bomber, saying they’re part of some terrorist group called Angry Homeowners of America or something, and they’re taking the fight to the people.

So now when the news crews go out to this person’s house, which is filled with AK-47s and such, all the neighbors will say, “I can’t believe Joe would do such a thing, I would have never suspected it. We’ve known him for years, we had dinner once a month.” This isn’t some guy from the Middle East, this is the neighbor that’s been next to you for ten years, someone you consider close and a friend.

Now obviously one attack won’t cause pandemonium, you’ll need lots. Big town suburbs will work, but they need to diversify into all states and areas. No place is safe. And the media can think the parents are getting their children in on the action too. Little Timmy comes to school with a bomb strapped around his chest, now no parent will want to send their kid to school.

Even if the real terrorists are outed, it won’t stop their momentum. People still won’t know who’s being coerced into bombing places, so they’ll still be paranoid and suspect everyone as a terrorist.

People will board themselves in their homes, keeping their children by their side. The nation stops functioning, no one wants to leave their homes for work or school. Soon people start accusing each other of being a terrorist. “Jimbo, that strange character that keeps to himself at the end of the block must be a terrorist, friggin weirdo. I’m gonna get my shotgun and show him the true meaning of red, white, and blue.”

And so it’s every man for himself, all hell breaks lose, and the country tears itself apart.

Plot: The group of terrorists are out to disrupt us economically.

The popular mode of “24” panning to 4 scenes at once can be utilized at various points in the movie when several things get coordinated at once.

First the movie starts with my original idea, (hard to give up, I love that one.)

A series of tractor-trailers, either rented, owned, or hijacked are brought onto the Freeways of Los Angeles at afternoon rush hour. It is a coordinated effort at various choke points timed for 5PM. All they do is jack-knife those trucks at the choke points. Like the 405/134 interchange, the 405/605 interchange, the 605/10 interchange and the 5/405 interchange. After the trucks are flipped over, the perpetrators simply walk away, ostensibly to a waiting lead car.

End result, the majority of commerce and traffic in L.A. are disrupted for a day, causing millions in damage. Clueless law-enforcement units recriminate themselves and point fingers. (The sidekick and comic-relief can be inserted here, assuming the hero was introduced in the traffic tie-up as a local law enforcement officer.)

The next half hour is built in plot development. The perpetrators working on their next caper. To damage one or several oil refineries in the U.S. at the same time. Scenes from the ARCO plant near Long Beach can be used for the rest of the movie.

Raison d‚Äô√™tre: Given the current U.S. situation, everyone is mad at the sudden increase in gasoline prices. Much of the blame can be rested on the lack of refinery capacity. As radio pundits are fond to claim, there hasn’t been a new refinery built in the U.S. in 30 years. A side dialogue can be used to blame environmentalists. A sudden disruption in the gasoline flow could cause nationwide economic chaos, ala “Atlas Shrugged” (using gas instead of railways and copper.)

(Note this situation exacerbated in just the last 10 days since your April 15th newsletter announcing the contest. I hadn’t thought of this then.)

A few gratuitious scenes of potential riots at the pump should be added. (Food riots due to failed out-of-fuel truck delivery systems too.)

The remainder of the story would be the build-up to the eventual climax. Perpetrators plotting, handing out cash, renting cars, getting in place, casing their targets, etcetera.

Government counter-terrorist units should be portrayed as bumbling fools. The perpetrator’s plot should be discovered at the grass-roots cop (our hero) on the street level. When the plot is stopped, it should be prevented by the unwashed masses. Watchful refinery workers at the plant for example (perhaps with a hint from our hero,) notice the econo-terrorists casing the place. They in turn, get in touch with other refinery workers at other plants in other parts of the country, (perhaps via family, or union connections) who notice the same thing. (Joe guy-on-the-street feel-good time, yeah.)

Of course they coordinate local-law enforcement just in the nick of time. Depending on the Director, more gratuitous scenes of mass-violence, perhaps a lynching at the refinery of a captured perpetrator, cross-beams (maybe prevented just in the nick of time by our hero or sidekick, with a feel-good speech of the usual “we can’t become like them” theme.

Hundreds of extras can be hired in the Los Angeles area. This should help invigorate the local film industry which is stagnant. (Due to egress to out of country filming.)

Here’s another two cents worth of possible, but not probable, terror plots.

Fundamentalist pilots in the Royal Saudi Air Force (there’s probably more than a few) use the cover of a training mission to fly away with two F-15 fighters and a tanker plane for mid-air refueling. Flying low and evasively, they make their way up the Red Sea, across the Sinai, over the Mediterranean, and out into the Atlantic. Refueling repeatedly on the long flight across the Atlantic, they approach the American coast. Dropping below radar or using the cover of a passing commercial jet, they cross the Chesapeake Bay and head for the airspace over Washington. Still unchallenged, they fly over downtown D.C. and attack the White House, the Capital and landmark monuments with Sidewinder missiles. Pedestrians and traffic around the Mall are strafed with the F15’s 20mm cannon. Sparrow air-to-air missiles are used to attack commercial air traffic around National Airport or any National Guard F-15s that manage to respond to the airspace intrusion. Finally, the two F-15s and their lumbering tanker crash into various buildings along the Mall.

Fantasy? Hopefully. But U.S. F15s made the reverse flight during the Gulf War, refueling seven times for the 15-hour flight from Langley AFB, Virginia to Saudi Arabia. The Saudi Air Force also has the necessary KC-130 tankers for aerial refueling. The F15 has a 3,000 nautical miles range with conformal fuel tanks and three external fuel tanks. The Saudi Air Force has 15 F-15D fighters configured for two pilots (one can sleep while the other flies), and 47 single-seat F-15Cs. The F15 can be armed with a 20mm, six-barrel cannon; four Sidewinder and four Sparrow air-to-air missiles. It’s a lot of firepower to use against non-military targets.

God Hands ‚Ä¢ April 26, 2006 2:19 AM

Terrorists infilitrate a Pakistani Airliner headed for the United States via Europe. The passengers themselves are harmless — except for one man. He is clearly of Middle-Eastern/Pakistani appearance, but is dressed as a business man; much older and more distinguished than the prototypical terrorist.

Amongst his “Western business man” possessions is a cellular phone, not unlike the other passengers aboard this airplane. But this phone, unlike the others, is linked to a low-yield nuclear bomb hidden away in the plane’s cargo hold…

The bomb itself was “smuggled” aboard by al-Queda operatives under the aegis of Pakistan’s ISI intelligence force. Months prior to this operation, the ISI had trained and supported select al-Queda jihadists to work as airline luggage employees. After successful training, the ISI helped to plant the men at the airport flying out of Islamabad. These men played their parts as luggage handlers with impeccable skill.

The nuclear weapon was also provided to the operatives by the ISI, in disassembled parts. The parts were re-assembled under the supervision of Pakistani nuclear weapons scientists. Once completed, the bomb was “disguised” — its outer shell was removed and it was buried within several lead-encased boxes. These boxes were then painted/covered over with a wood grain finish. Some of these boxes were actually packed with clothes, personal items, etc. — anything needed to add to the legitimacy of the cargo. Finally, the “hot item” was loaded into the airliner; it avoided x-ray detection through the efforts of the inside men working within the airport.

When the plane reaches Europe, the lone operative aboard (the business man), makes a seemingly innocuous phone call. But the dismal reality is this phone call arms the bomb through a frequency in the business man’s cell phone. The modified phone sends a signal directly to a receiving mechanism on the bomb itself.

That receiving mechanism is a barometer-based gauge. Once the plane descends into US airspace, the barometer is triggered and engages the short-fuse timer. Moments thereafter, the bomb explodes as the plane makes its final descent.

Because the plane’s altitude is still relatively high and its course steady, the US rapid-response air defenses fail to see the threat coming. No F-16s are sent to intercept, and no air-traffic control warnings are issued to the plane.

The plane’s in-bound status from Europe also aids the terrorists; if the plane were on a direct Pakistan-to-US flight, then a greater level of scrutiny would have been placed upon it by the United States.

Finally, because the plane’s altitude is still relatively high, the resulting nuclear detonation is far more devastating because the bomb has enough height to clear any potential buildings that might othewise mitigate its blast, however nominal that may be.

Terror Plot Movie Contest:

Molly was born when her step-father, Hank, made her older sister, Lilly, pregnant.

When Molly learned of this, at a young age, the stigma and guilt always followed as she matured within an immature backwood red state town, a place where conferate flags still flew and where Klan grandfathers were idolized and worshipped. Anti-homo and big-hipped Hillary jokes as popular as the Bud in the only bar miles around. Her husband’s picture adorned the dartboard where knives and ice picks were thrown instead of darts.

Always cowering before these stubbornhicked hardnosed bubbahs and now doing the bidding of Uncle Hank, all Molly wanted to do was please everyone she met. You see, it was all she could do. It was all everyone wanted her to do.

At the young, tender age of 13, Molly– weak from a whippin’ by Hank’s brother, Uncle Ned–hooked up with her best friend, BettySue, who knew someone with a truck and would drive them out of town.

With not many places to go in these parts they got dropped off at the truck stop located on the state road, next town over.

Here they easily met a a couple of long-haulers, Virgil and Mitt. And an exciting evening of twilight sex had all of them, Molly with Virgil and BettyLou with Mitt.

Sure they’d never done anything like this before, but what did they care–they waz just wantin’ to meet and be with someone new–it wasn’t like they never did anything that hadn’t already been done to them before.

After the sex romp, Virgil and Mitt bought a hearty home-styled dinner for the two young women. Molly found herself sittin’ next to Mitt, the trucker who’d just been hammering her friend. He kept fondling her under the table and couldn’t stop whispering in her ear.

All Molly could do was eat, smile and listen. For Molly’s world this was better than it had ever had been.

Dinner was done, the moon was full and fate moved heavy as Molly, almost automatically, found herself waving bye-bye to BettyLou, Molly had fixed her mind that she was gonna be Mitt’s traveling squeeze.

And he had told her during dinner that she was gonna see all of America! Molly was new!

While the big rig, already thundered-up, heaved and weaved out from the walls other rigs, Molly thought: “Lordy–(she knew some ’bout religion; but not much)–I’ll never ever see that BettyLou again!”

But her next thought struck her like a joyful bolt of lightning: No more of that Crawdaddy Hank, no more of that nasty Uncle Ned and no more of that stupid silly Lilly–no more of the horrid place Molly once called home–she was leaving the house where she’d been born forever–whatever that meant!

“Yippie” she squeeled against the sound of the truck’s wheels, peeping through her sided rear-view mirror and watching the truck stop and her last image of Betty Lou disappear more and more.

The large-framed mirror also caused her to see the mirror of her own eyes. It was a nice glimpse into herself.

Molly was leaving pretty!

Next, she snookered hip-to-hip close to the now very-happy but concentrating trucker. Placing her arms over Mitt’s plaid-shirted shoulders, she whispered sweetly into his passenger-side ear, “thanks, Mitt.”

With a kiss she Molly gone!

Over the next five years, Mitt long gone, she bounced from one trucker to the next handsomest one; or sometimes just being with the one who treated her the nicest. And many were the fistfights and broken beer bottles she’d left behind as they all wanted to duke it out to get her.

Even though all she was conditioned, all she ever wanted to do was please, it was hard to keep Molly.

Everyone loved Molly! Everyone wanted Molly.

By the time she’d hit the age 18 she knew every truck stop and almost every trucker in America, always refusing to go to a truck stop near to where she was born. Heck, she’d just pick up another trucker rather than go that route–and she met all kinds of people along the way.

Everyone wanted Molly.

On a cloudy day, somewhere on the outskirts of of Akron, Ohio, Molly met her first mobster, Nick The Flick. Nick was there to negotiate a deal with Ernie–the trucker who’d been buying Molly’s meals, paying for flea-bagged motels and banging her hard–to haul some heavy drugsk coast to coast.

Nick, by his darting and quivering eyes and the way his hands furiously moved, obviously took an instant hankering to Molly. He couldn’t stop looking at her, up and down, as he instructed Ernie on what had to happen for the deal to happen.

When it ended, without any say at all in the matter, Molly suddenly realized she’d become part of the deal.

Now she’s Nick’s.

They drove away olden, well-maintained and highly-polished black cadellac–this was very different to the big rigs she long had been used to being in.

The Flick tried his best to make her feel comfortable with him. He was older, different than anyone she’d ever been with before. She knew this, but it didn’t matter much after he bought her all kinds of fancy stuff, including clothes she’d never seen before and ones much nicer than the simple cutoffs, skimpy haltertops and plaid shirts she was accustomed to.

After all Molly’d been through before, she was only mildly astonished to discover that she was about to become the new and featured stripper at Flicks, Nick’s two-bit strip joint on the edges of Cincinnati.

Nick promised her she’d become an instant hit in his club, she’d be his best act–and that everyone would love her!

And so it happened.

Briefly into her new, first and only career ever, Molly began receiving something she’d never had before: legitimate attention for something that she controlled. It was different than just a man controlling her body.

Nick was right. Everybody who saw her loved her! She even got to know some of bible-thumping preachers and distant city politicans who’d sometimes come in and start out by sitting in the back rows. But by the end of her dance routine, they were as close to Molly as could possibly be.

This happened night after night. Over and over, her hair long and flowing, beautiful and always in a new change of brilliant coloring, Molly showered her extremely lithe body, her almond joy, her breasts perky with protrusion hard as could be at the two most important points–on everyone.

She was as well-built of a woman as well-built woman could be. The whistles and catcalls she got were as deafening as any heard anywhere. It was almost like an entirely new sound.

In between her dancing acts she’d schmooze with her fans. She’d use her penetrating knowledge from her past, what she knew about trucks. She gave Peterbilt and Kenworth new meaning

Her sure southern-style and sweetsong voice were siren lures. When she walked, no one talked; when she winked, hearts would sink; when she smiled the room went wild.

Molly finally found a home!

She enjoyed making most men–if not all men (remember the preachers?)–melt too deeply in their own pants. Finally, she had some power and control.

Still, however, Molly was not in complete control. She’d really only become a precious commodity, a value to anyone able to control her.

So you can imagine Molly’s near disappointment when, after finally doing so well, somewhat on her own, that she learned Nick The Flick had given her to someone else in exchange for part interest in some condos in Florida.

Enter into Molly’s life Chicago mob boss, Domi The Dommino. Molly was his next. Dealing with mobsters, there was nothing she could do but go with the flow.

She was thinking stripping for mobsters was better than being a truck whore for roughians; and that being a truck whore for roughians was better than living with the kind of family that inbred her. She knew all of this too well.

As usual, The Dommino wouldn’t do the deal with The Flick unless he got Molly in the deal. He did.

Surprisingly, the dark olive-skinned, dapper and somewhat whimsical gangster sweetened Molly’s pie when he told her he’d treat her right, that he could help to change her life for the better and he promised her that she’d make lotsa money. He even assured her he’d get her some education–Molly’s weak point.

Of all the promises, all but the last one she’d heard before in varying ways. It was the education part that appealed mostly.

Although she’d been all over America and met so many different kinds of people, she never ever thought of herself as anything but a road smart but still someone else’s dumb babe.

For sure she knew how to charm a man, even a trucker or a preacher; she knew how clever to become, or just what to do in order get by in bed; and she knew she how to look absolutely stunning, with or without clothing, while dancing on dim-lit and eye-lit, smoked-filled strip stage. Lately, that’s all there was.

And then there was the always continuous string of sad, never joyful very bad memories. Which is probably why she never became a heavy drinker, her sorrows were too thick to even think of when drunk.

So Molly saw her next fading image. It was Nick The Flick.

There he hung at the end, wearing one of many sharkskin suits, smoking any one of many different Cuban cigars and leaning with a kept confidence, his shoulder on the side his club entrance. His face flushed funny in glimmering of sthe bright flash bulbed lights where the marquee read, “Now Dancing–Good Golly Miss Molly, her stage name.

When driving away, as she peered out the window, she first thought that Nick was tipping his hat to her. She then thought better of it, for she knew Nick would only tip his hat toward The Dominno. She knew if it were she to whom he was bidding adieu, he’d at least blow a kiss in her direction. He didn’t. He got condos!

So now Nick’s gone, no more dancing at The Flick–it’ll be different all over again.

As usual, her thoughts skipped to the bright side. Although she only went from one mobster to another, at least this time she had a better sense as to what would come.

She’d given up bubbah’s pickup truck; she’d given up the big rigs; and today she’d given up the polished caddy.

Molly was now being chauferred in a long, sleek and plush white, not black limo. And the man next to her was high end. She wasn’t just gonna now pass through Chicago, she was gonna become the heartthrough of the city. She thought about her own heart, but didn’t have time.

You see, everyone loves Molly–and now The Dommino has her.

It was a long drive to Chicago. All the way, she fondled and got fondled by her new control, Domi, who in between his graspy feels he filled her head with dreams of what a great stripper she was about to become, what Chicago would be like, who she’d meet and what she could do living in a such a large and important city.

As they eventually closed in on the city, he talked about Chicago’s blues clubs. Her ears perked and her body shimmered. She had only recently learned about the blues and black people.

Molly was sick of country music. She hated it, what with the many truckers in her life. While in Cincinatti she’d gotten deep into rocknroll and disco, especially while dancing at The Flick. But blues music was new to her and she wanted to experience it fully.

As they entered the city she put her complete past even further behind her.

After settling into a nice penthouse, she discovered Chicago was perfect, all it could be. Her stripper friends were prettier, more intelligent and it seemed like they knew better ways to do everything. But, more importantly, they liked her too and for the first time in her life, really since BettyLou, she made some friends. Real friends.

Again, everyone liked Molly!

Domi, true to his word about education, set Molly up with a recently divorced college professor. Bertran was a microbiologist from the University of Chicago, who’d frequently visit many of Domi’s clubs where Molly had become almost the top-billed, if not the top-billed dancer.

Bertran would follow her from club to club and always, because of Domi’s purposeful introduction, got time with her where he’d teach her something new, something of educational value. And, of course, he’d get a little (not much) in return. But they became very good friends.

The next year was a good for Molly–really, the best year in her life. The only downside was that she got to know Domi more and began observing some of the dark side. But, as always, she was excellent at looking the other way, She ignored that part.

And even that became moot when one day Domi told her he was setting her up on a national tour, that she’d be dancing at the very best, the most prestigious, strip clubs all throughout America’s best cities.

She was promised lots of money, something she never really, until recently, had much of. Nor did she have much need of money since the person who controlled her always provided what was needed.

Domi was married and had a family, so they were only part-time lovers.

Molly actually had some freedom in Chicago and her blues were now the good blues, the musical blues, not the bad ones. She and her stripper friends hit all the clubs and were welcomed as special guests everywhere they went.

Molly’s table had finally been set.

When the tour happened Molly found herself jet-setting from club to club, from Boston and New York to Miami and Atlanta to Houston and Dallas and LA and Vegas. And most everywhere she went her nationally-renowed friend Bertran kept connecting her with professerial types who’d always wanna trade her learnin’ for their yearnin’. Sometimes even Bertran would show up.

Molly actually had became intelligent. By now, she knew how to get anything she wanted, wherever she wanted and when she wanted it. And Domi too, when he could get away, would also visit her and whatever city they’d be in would be theirs.

Everybody loved Molly and Molly was conditioned to please. She did.

But fate took yet another twist when Domi, while the two were vacationing and gambling in San Juan, fell ill after a heavy bout of sex. She learned the next day he had died due to heart complications. She was heartbroken.

Domi’s funeral was not easy for Molly, as his wife and his entire family were present. She pretty much stayed in the background throughout the arrangements.

It was here she met a tall, handsome Arab-accented man. Husam was a world traveler and he knew as much about the whole world as she knew about all of America.

For the first time in her life she was free–there was no one to control or need for anyone to provide for her. She could actually begin making her own decisions.

After the funeral Molly returned to her penthouse in Vegas. She wasn’t dancing anymore, she’d already done an occassional porn scene here and there, but didn’t like the people involved in that industry and, beautiful as she was, she had become too marked for Hollywood.

All she had was her beauty and lotsa money, money that she’d made being a famous dancer and even more money that Domi had left her–she was in his will.

From bubbahs to truckers to mobsters; from preachers to politicians to judges, academics and CEOs of the major and minor corporations–Molly knew every kind of American there was. And even with all of this, for the first time in her life, she became bored. Very bored. Didn’t gave a clue what to do next.

This got solved one sunny day when her telephone rang. It was Husam. He wanted her to travel with him and visit several European countries. She did and they in the best hotels, dined at the finest restaurants and danced in the best clubs possible. He became her lover … her international lover!

It seemed like everywhere she went all she found were adoring people who absolutely revered and loved Husam.

Molly, for the first time in her life, was finally happy doing what she wanted to do and not what someone else wanted her to do. But even so still she was conditioned to please people, especially men.

Steven McDougall ‚Ä¢ April 26, 2006 11:19 PM

Roddy at April 2, 2006 05:11 PM proposes pumping air into a gas pipeline to create an explosive mixture, and then igniting it. I think it would be hard to do much damage that way.

First, you can’t just pump air into the pipeline. You’ll set off pressure alarms and blow safety valves. To go undetected for more than a few minutes (seconds?) you’d have to remove an equal amount of gas. You could do that, but now the plumbing is more complicated.

At a 10-to-1 air to gas ratio, there’s not much gas left. You could do better by pumping in O2; then you only need a 2-to-1 ratio. But now you need tanks of O2, and the scale of the attack is limited by the number of tanks you can amass.

I don’t know about trans-continental pipelines, but the gas pipes that run under city streets are at 50 PSI, which is just over 3 atmospheres, and the pressure is downregulated to a few PSI at the gas meter before it enters a building. So there isn’t that much gas in the pipes, and that limits the size of the bang.

You don’t get to choose the time of detonation. The gas will detonate as soon as any of it reaches a lit burner or pilot light, and that will probably happen before you’ve pumped very much O2 into the system. The detonation will probably propagate back through the system, although it might stop at the meter, the pressure regulator, or the thermocouple cutoff. In any case, it would be hazardous to your health to be attending the O2 injection equipment when this happens.

The original post talked about a 2.5 ton (of TNT) explosion, but I think that is optimistic. And whatever explosion you do get is going to be distributed through great lengths of pipe. Most of that length is underground, so not many people will be hurt. If it ruptures pipes, safety systems will cut off the flow immediately. Even if it doesn’t, the gas company is going to know that something is seriously wrong.

My guess is that the best you can do with an attack like this is
– start a few fires
– cause a few injuries
– wreck some gas meters and appliances
– rupture some gas mains (as backhoe operators have always done)

One additional cost going forward might be the need to inspect equipment and appliances for damange before they can be put back into service. There could be a lot more potentially damanged equipment than actually damage equipment, and the only way to find out is to have a licensed technician go on-site to see. That could multiply the ultimate cost of the attack.

Even so, I don’t think this is a 9-11 class attack. It is more nusicance-level.

What are the two types of people terrorists hate?

Capitalists and hedonists.

That was before September 11.

Now, it’s not so easy.

I suggest that the greatest threat to America isn’t located on American soil.

Hedonists congregate in hot spots all over the world, often in second world countries where proximity to sun-warmed sand in January is more important than access to the best medicine, infrastructure, or security.

Jamaica mon!

My folks used to have a black box. We got all the channels‚ÄîPlayboy included. One evening, on a college break, I was flipping channels and I settled on Hugh Hefner’s television enterprise.

A commercial advertised a resort week sponsored by the Playboy channel called Hedonism 3.

A weekend of drunken debauchery, fornication, and drug use promises the most bang for the buck — for party people and terrorists alike.

The storyline pitches both sides against each other.

In one corner, stand idealistic extremists who seek enlightenment through martyrdom.

In the other corner, sit hedonists who find enlightenment and pleasure through sexual gratification and mind altering substances.

Both groups ultimately have the same goals. Whether in this life or the after-life, both groups seek bliss.

flashmob ‚Ä¢ April 27, 2006 2:51 PM

Plot: the US has a network of satellites designed to provide an early warning of a nuclear attack. Those satellites, known as Defense Support Program (DSP) satellites, can detect the infrared energy radiated from the hot exhaust of a missile’s rocket engine launched from anywhere on the earth’s surface. In 1979, the system indicated a massive Soviet nuclear strike. The entire continental air defense interceptor force was put on alert, and at least 10 fighters took off. Furthermore, the National Emergency Airborne Command Post, the president’s “doomsday plane,” was also launched, but without the president on board. It was later determined that a realistic training tape had been inadvertently inserted into the computer running the nation’s early-warning programs. See http://www.pbs.org/wgbh/nova/missileers/falsealarms.html

In this plot, terrorists construct infrared “bombs” made from thermite http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thermite with the aim of creating false nuclear launch alarms in the DSP system. They make a large number of these bombs and deploy them throughout Russia in proximity (as close as possible) to actual nuclear launch silos, whereupon they are set off simultaneously, simulating a massive launch of nuclear missiles. This in turn provokes an actual nuclear exchange between the US and Russia.

Ken ‚Ä¢ April 28, 2006 11:08 AM

  1. Terrorists construct a large number of small bombs triggered by GPS.
  2. The bombs can be posted, or hidden inside another object that is likely to pass through the target map reference (inside a car door panel, inside a printer being delivered, inside a hollowed out book in a fake Amazon box, etc)
  3. They phone the police and give just a map reference and a code-word
  4. They then transport one of the bombs to that location using whatever means is available. No hurry.
  5. Repeat steps 3 & 4
  6. Some of the map references may take months or years to get hit.
  7. Promulgate rumours about particular locations (shopping malls, a particular government department, a popular night-club)
  8. Increase the frequency of calls whenever the DHS puts the alert level up and reduce the frequency when they put it down. This reduces the ability of the intelligence services to identify genuine information leaks.
  9. Any site mentioned in a rumour the terrorists did not start themselves is made a target.
  10. After the public have got used to this, start using map references that are on roads. Eventually a car passing through this map reference explodes. Later warnings become virtual road blocks. Bus routes have to be redesigned. Cabs refuse to take passengers to locations at risk.

Anticipated result: extensive searches become commonplace – nobody can be sure that they are not carrying a hidden device. Random businesses fail because people are too scared to visit. Government buildings at critical map references are either abandoned or become subject to such stringent checks that work in them becomes massively inefficient. Traffic is subject to random interruption. The kind of treatment that people are becoming used to at airports percolates into everyday life. The terrorists win.

Something that would make Americans panic, feel threatened … hmmm …

Let’s look at the facts:
1) People in the US are vigilant about security depending on their level of awareness of the problem, their intelligence and (more importantly) their experience.
2) Having said all this, everyone wants “appropriate security measures” in place even if s/he doesn’t know what they should be in the first place.
3) Everyone reacts indignantly if a security measure was found to be lacking – implying the level of concern about security.
4) People feel helpless when told about a weak security measure .. if it is beyond their control. If the police/FBI/government should have done something, I can be angry about the incompetence but there’s not a lot that I can do right now, on a practical level, except be angry.

So, here is the movie-plot based on the above …

Attack a peace loving, inconsequential country few people have heard of and use that standard jihad explanation – “Get the US out of Iraq/Afghanistan/wherever and we’ll stop bombing innocents.

The country I live in (Malta GC, Europe) is small (smaller than most Western cities) with a population of 400,000. About 40 – 50% of the population travel to the capital each day to work or shop which means rush hour (7.30 – approx 8.30) sees tons of people on the roads. Place bombs on the only two roads leading to the capital to cause havoc there, (and block police from leaving their HQ in the capital), another one on the only exit road from the hospital to deviate ambulances and two others in road tunnels which are usually full of traffic and upon which flats and houses are built. The chaos will grab world headlines. The difficulty with providing help and supplies (One airstrip, quite a few ports but the roads will be out) will make the situation worse. Then the bad guys launch a statement claiming that they’ll hit other nations who are so peaceful that they have few security concerns .. unless the US backs down.

They kill innocents right now anyway …

My entry for the Movie Plot contest:

8 PM Monday, News of the assasination of the Baboonian Ambassadors family reach the media. Even though the country belongs to the dodecahedron of evil, the President, in a televised statement, calls the murder an “horrendous act”, and promises a full investigation.

8 PM, Wednesday. News of the assasination of the families of members of the government shock the nation. The whole country speculates on the relationship to the murder on Monday.

11 PM, Wednesday. Fires have been reported throught the northwest of the city, Firefighters are sent to investigate.

1 AM, Thursday. The amount of what now appears to be be massive arsonist attacks, is putting a strain on the emergency response services, fires just seem to keep spreading without triggering alarm. First casualties are reported. Phone calls are received threatening to detonate bombs around petrochemical plants.

2 AM. Small incendiary devices have been found in some abandoned buildings.

4 AM, Although the fire belts around major pretrochemical storage sites seem to be undercontrol, investigations are under way into what now seems an organised attack.

6:45 AM. The operators of underground lines have received calls claiming bombs in the underground tunnels crossing the river, the service is stopped, and passengers start to emerge of what otherwise are small tube stations.

7:00 AM. The tube operators start to organise buses to look for alternative crossings while a bomb squad is sent to investigate. Passengers keep coming out of the stations.

7:03 AM. Car bombs explode in hospital parking spots.

7:05 AM. Bombs explode on the bus stops of the tube stations.

7:09 AM. A second wave of bombs explode opposite the bus stations.

8:00 AM The Ambassador of Baboonia laments the the attacks, calling them “horrendous acts”, and denies any involvement.

War with Baboonia begins.

(Needless to say, the whole operation has not been planned by the Baboonian government, which is what agent Smith discovers later.)

MCR ‚Ä¢ April 29, 2006 12:34 PM

Movie Plot Threat Contest entry

Title: Neurolinguistic Terrorism

The terrorists take neurolinguistic programming to its most horrific conclusion: they develop a short speech in English that will cause susceptible people who listen to it to become suicidal and basically do anything to make the thoughts induced by the speech stop. The terrorists spend many months schooling a group of non-native speakers of English (and thus immune) in exactly the right wordings, intonations, breath groupings, etc. Their more militant members then take over one or more radio or TV stations and deliver The Speech. The initial response by most is derision until the captain of a LNG tanker detonates his ship in Newport News shipyard, killing tens of thousands and completely destroying the yard (an LNG detonation would be about as bad as a small nuke). There are also numerous more minor incidents, like deliberate train derailments, school teachers murdering their home room classes, etc. The most devastating aspect, of course, is the pervasive terror that results. No one will listen to any form of broadcast media. No one will trust anyone else since they might had heard The Speech and are thus a ticking timebomb. Western society, culture and the economy collapse.
(With apologies to William Gibson, Steven King, Rod Serling, HP Lovecraft, William S. Burroughs, China Mieville and many other authors who thought of this already)

Dmitry Dvoinikov ‚Ä¢ April 30, 2006 4:25 AM

Acts of physical terror of unimaginable scale is hopefully beyond reach of a described group (10-20 unskilled people, $500000).

Killing a limited amount ex. thousands of people by bombing or otherwise would be terrible, but would not cause any significant shift, no matter which social category they’d belong to. Take the explosion in Russian Checnen school in Beslan. Several hundred children (basically the entire school) died in a blast after being kept hostages for few days in September 2004. Did it change anything ? Not a single thing. Sure, in situations like this the government takes the chance to pass the laws it needs and there is a lot of talk, but otherwise nothing changes.

Likewise, wiping the entire country population by poisoning the water supplies or something like that is out because such contaguious viruses or dangerous chemicals are either not capable enough, not cheap enough or will strike them back. Besides, it’s not the point, terror is not about killing, it’s about letting live in fear.

And so the best alternative is likely to be indirect manipulation from behind the curtains. An investment into racism and hate, which is already tense enough throughout the world, will return tenfold.

For example, publishing a single cartoon has caused hundreds of people to voluntarily damage the associated country’s assets. Was there a bit of such manipulation in this case ? No way to tell for sure but it’s highly likely.

Then again, in which way such an unskilled group can affect the way the majority of the population perceives the situation ? Propaganda, normal for the government and huge corporations is out. Therefore what’s left is probably an indirect instigation, by highly focused attacks on people of very specific groups. A group of 10 could enjoy a huge amplification in effect as soon as the affected group will strike back the wrong target. It wouldn’t necessarily be a riot, but even a slow burning on the inside would impact the society.

It’s difficult to say which group should be targeted and it certainly depends on the country or even local situation, for example in Germany in 1920s it appeared beneficial to target jews. I’m sure special government squads were secretly raiding both sides at that time to ensure both don’t return to normal.

Therefore, a group with such a limited capabilities could have found a spot in which a high tension in society already presents and try to feed the fire until the tension is unbearable. The goal would then not be to cause a riot or anything in particular, it’d be a slowly pushing people in the right direction.

It’d take a lot of very careful thought, a lot of time and the outcome is not predictable at all, but this is exactly the point – the dinosaurs were not killed by the stone falling from the sky, but by the slow climate changes that came after.

And it also appears that right now people are not ready to resist such an attack. Living in a world of lies, propaganda and advertisement, they would rather fight very specific particular threats rather than subtle changes in the wind. More likely not only they wouldn’t notice it until it’s too late, but they would try not to notice.

BobO ‚Ä¢ April 30, 2006 6:12 AM

The terrorists are split into 5 groups of 4 each. A mother, a father, and two children. Each group travels around the country dumping a variety of bio-contaminants into local water supplies. The contaminants are contained in swim floats: rafts that are weighted enough to settle at the bottom of reservoir where they will be almost impossible to discover. The fuse is a substance put into the air filler tube of each raft. The substance dissolves at the rate of about an eighth of an inch per day. The rafts are set to go off from two to three weeks after they have been deployed. Over a week’s time each group hits 30 water supplies.

The bio-contaminants were obtained from a mothballed military facility where security had been out-sourced to a foreign company. In general, the security and accounting at the facility have gotten so bad due to budget cuts that the stolen items would not be missed for years, if at all.

If the terrorists are stopped they look like a family going to the beach that mistook the reservoir for a public lake.

After all of the reservoirs are infected. Each group loads up their mini-vans with 60 gallons of gasoline. This is done through the regular filler cap which has been re-routed to a gas hot water heater sitting in the trunk area of the mini-van. The fuse is put together from pieces of various fireworks that were legally purchased in states like Indiana. The terrorists are careful to take no more that 15 gallons from each gas station that they visit and to use cash so that no credit card alerts are raised.

Their targets are Boys Town, The Mayo Clinic, a Catholic Cathedral, a large Christian fundamentalist church, and a synagogue. These are bonuses. The real reason for the bombings are to insure that the terrorists cannot be captured and coerced into revealing which reservoirs have been poisoned.

A possible plot line –

A small team of people collects the mold that has been allowed to fester in the areas that were hit by the hurricanes, such as New Orleans. (While areas that were hit by tsunamis across the globe have reported serious mold problems, the US still remains optimistic and quiet about the possible mold infestations.)

If one of the people could work for the US Treasury, he or she would have the opportunity to contaminate various forms of currency. Mucormycosis would affect some people, more probably children, elderly, pregnant women, and those with weakened immune systems.

If random forms of currency are “attacked,” it would take longer to locate the source of infection. Over time, this would weaken the economy as many people are not able to convert to debit and credit cards and many businesses only accept cash.

After that attack, the mold could be placed in recycled paper products. If it is not placed in one specific product such as paper towels, it becomes much harder to trace.

This tactic can be used to enhance any other good threat/plot.

Come up with thirty terrorist plans (similar or not) taking place all over the country. Print these all up with detailed schematics, maps, pictures, public transportation schedules, etc.

Put these all in one room.

Perform one terrorist attack and leave clues on the scene that lead to this room.

The idea could be that the first terrorist was stupid, and jumped the gun by a day or two, or April 21 was transposed to April 12, etc.

Resources needed:
1 terrorist
1 pack of matches (maybe he starts a fire as first “attack”)
1 laser printer
