B. Badonov ‚Ä¢ May 26, 2006 10:02 PM

[This is a treatment for a screenplay. The working title is “Vegetable Stand”.]

It started at the supermarket in the New England suburb of Stepford. A housewife in the produce section was blasted with pulp when a rutabaga exploded.

Over the next few weeks, rutabagas blew up in supermarkets around the country. There were no significant injuries, but plenty of messes. Tabloids were full of stories about celebrities who’d been rutabagaed.

At first, the whole thing was considered a prank, and was attributed to bored teenagers. After all, what could be more natural than kids wanting to blow up vegetables? The only serious effort to stop the trend was a public service campaign called “This is Your Brain on Rutabagas.” Nobody understood it, but at least late night TV talk shows had an abundance of material.

Then everything changed. A TV station in Seattle received a letter from a group that called itself the “Rutabaga Liberation Army.” On the envelope were strange markings that forensic scientists thought might be some foreign language. America was under attack. The public was horrified; their own vegetables were being used against them.

A professor of rutabaga science conjectured that terrorists might be growing vegetables next to abandoned Cold War weapons plants. The Department of Homeland Security assured everyone that rutabagas were harmless. But to make sure, they requested a twenty-million-dollar grant from Congress to randomly test rutabagas for radiation. A spokesman from DHS told the public that if they didn’t continue eating rutabagas, the terrorists had won.

Half of Congress gathered for a media event on the steps of the Capitol, to gobble what the Capitol cafeteria called “Freedom Fruit.” Patriotism was a shopping bag full of rutabagas.

But not everyone was satisfied with the official line. The country was polarized. Half the population believed that rutabagas were a terrorist vegetable and refused to eat them. The other half insisted that eating rutabagas was one way ordinary patriotic Americans could stand up to terrorism.

Soaring demand caused a rutabaga shortage. Several members of the Organization of Rutabaga-Exporting Countries talked about using rutabagas as an economic weapon against the United States. Overnight, public sentiment turned against rutabagas.

That’s when the violence against rutabaga farmers began. A dazed man fell from a truck and was found in the street by a mob, lying in what appeared to be a pile of rutabagas. He was almost lynched before the cryptic vegetables were identified as turnips. Farms known to produce rutabagas suffered arson at twice the rate of farms producing only turnips.

Security companies that examined the belongings of people entering public buildings began to screen for rutabagas. The Transportation Security Administration prohibited rutabagas on airplanes. A woman was caught trying to smuggle one onto a plane. She had disassembled it, cooked it, and hidden the parts in a vegetable stew. A team in hazmat suits carried her lunch onto the tarmac and blew it up. The White House Press Secretary exhibited satellite photographs of secret trailers full of rutabagas in Iran.

Congress voted to spend three hundred million dollars for research on alternative vegetables. Within a week of the first public service announcements urging everyone to support the Parsnip Movement, six parsnips detonated in supermarkets. The American people were stunned. Global warming and gay marriage were forgotten.

Nobody had ever been brought to justice for the rutabaga attacks, and the public was enraged. Congress passed the Killer Rutabagas And Parsnips Act, which created a federal agency with a four-billion-dollar budget. Using recent discoveries in quantum gravitational theory, new vegetable detectors were developed and installed in airports. Expenses were much larger than expected; the budget had to be doubled. Other law enforcement programs were looted to supply the funds. In the six months after passage of the KRAP Act, there were ten thousand more robberies than in a similar period a year earlier.

Over time, the panic faded. People forgot that rutabagas existed — which in America, they didn’t. The War Against Vegetables appeared to be won.

And then a shopper was pushing a cart full of groceries to her car when they were destroyed by an incendiary banana in one of the bags. Exploding vegetables were one thing, but bananas were fruit. This changed everything. Again.

Next came the broccoli bombs. Desperation reigned. Prisons could barely be built fast enough to house the burgeoning population of vegetable abusers. And vegetable abuse was construed ever more broadly. Anyone who had the nerve to point out that “vegetable abuse” was meaningless double-talk was suspected of being a vegetable sympathizer, and was spirited away to a secret prison.

Nobody knew what might happen next. People started eating snack cakes instead of fruits and vegetables. To promote the illusion of a healthy diet, scientists at the Junk Food Institute developed a snack cake with a peel. The cake failed commercially because of persistent rumors that it was made from petroleum byproducts. Which it was. With the rapid diet changes, America was overwhelmed by simultaneous obesity and malnutrition.

American agriculture, its reputation demolished, could not compete in the world market. The balance of payments deteriorated, petroleum became scarce, prices rose and buying power plummeted. The American economy reeled. Half the world suffered through a profound depression, and the global balance of power shuddered.

And then the FBI announced they had discovered the perpetrators. A group of teenagers around the country had carried out the vegetable attacks, using the Internet for coordination. (The banana bombs had been copycat crimes by jealous adults.) But the kids all insisted that some powerful and enigmatic entity was behind the attacks. Finally, several informants independently named the Junk Food Institute. The FBI was getting ready to raid the headquarters of the JFI when the investigation was abruptly abandoned, three days after the President’s surprising re-election.

Too much about the attacks was never explained. One aspect in particular kept conspiracy theorists busy, although the President insisted it was mere coincidence: He, the Chairman of the Junk Food Institute and the president of one of the largest manufacturers of voting machines were all classmates in college. And all of them belonged to the most secret of secret societies — the Benevolent Order of the Rutabaga.

[Other title possibilities: “Rutabaga Rising”, “Night of the Rutabaga”, “Dead Men Don’t Eat Rutabagas”, “The Purple Testament”, “Vegetable Explosion”, “Rutabaga Sunrise”, “Rutabaga Wars”, “In Rutabagas There Is Truth”, “Rutabaga Dawn”, “Seize the Rutabaga”, “Rutabaga Force”, “Rage Against the Rutabagas”, “Vegetables of Dawn”, “Storage Roots of the Living Dead”, “It Came From the Vegetable Patch”, “Earth vs. the Flying Rutabagas”, “Everything You Always Wanted to Know About Rutabagas (but Were Afraid to Ask)”]

(Search terms: Emad Salem, Ralph Blumenthal, or just read the front page article in the NYT 28 Oct 1993.

It is feasible to make muzzle-loading smooth-bore cannons firing high-velocity saboted armor-piercing hardened, sharpened bolts with fins. Begin with oil well drill pipe, use ANFO as the powder. Load a trailer truck with a few hundred of these, park a few of them outside of IRS centers. You could shred their computer centers, with consequent loss of gov revenue for some time. This is pretty easy, pretty cheap, doesn’t take a big team, doesn’t require suicide bombers.

Consider an elevator shaft as a smooth-bore cannon. Load barrels of gasoline (or oxygen and acetelyne tanks) at ground level. Start the flow and send the elevators to the top floor, creating a fuel-air mixture allthe way up. Ignite fuel-air mixture. This kind of explosion very efficiently couples the energy to the building. At worst, the elevator is ejected through the roof and thousands of executives have heart-attacks climbing up to their offices. At best, the building is an economic loss due to no windows and structural damage, but it takes a long time to decide that. This doesn’t take a big team, can be done on a number of large buildings in one night across the country. Renting a warehouse, buying drill pipe and Ammonium Nitrate, few dozen trucks, etc. fits within the budget.

Send them off in the world to do their regular jobs with the stipulation that if they ever receive a missive from you they must enact it as instructed, in order to be ensured a place in heaven. You now have a dormant terrorist network that will survive for centuries.

Okay, that’s already been done, and the legacy of the Hashishim was (and possibly still is) the most effective terror network in history. They staged a drawn out campaign of political subterfuge and control that lasted hundreds of years. The particulars of the brainwashing took place against a cultural background which facilitated the delusion, but something similar could be developed for the Christian world I am sure.

The network gives the promise of an ongoing threat that can be used to stage personal attacks, political kidnappings and assassinations, as well as widespread mayhem perpetrated by a few individuals.

To ensure the greatest terror you must ensure that it will always be a threat, and that people feel there is no way to stop, anticipate, or control it. This can then be leveraged for real political power. A constant bombardment leaves people numb – not terrorized. You need the occasional horrific act followed by a long silence in which people know you are still operating to be most effective, whatever your tactics may be.

It may not have enough high-impact excitement to fit into a two hour movie, but maybe a good book…

I break my terrorists into cells of 4-5 people. The goal is to convince the American people to quit using all government services. In so doing it would have a huge impact on the economy and the state of mind of the American people. It would put incredible pressure on politicians to do something, it would dominate the news for as long as it continued.

Each group selects a government building (i.e. post office, social security, VA hospital etc.) The building is watched and a person is followed home (a mix of employees and regular citizens using the services). This person is kidnapped and beheaded, the event is videotaped and posted on the net, various news agencies receive copies of the video. The cell will claim that this person, an average American by using government services is supporting the oppression of good Muslims in the Far East. The videotape should start with the person leaving a clearly identified government building.

The demand is that the government should withdraw all soldiers from any location outside the US, and release all prisoners who are true brothers of Islam whether they are held in the US or outside of the US, regardless of the crime they are accused or guilty of. The tapes can also respond to news coverage and other current events.

The cell then packs up, moves to another city and repeats the process.

The effect is to make everyone question their personal safety, and make it difficult for them to take advantage of the services they are entitled to. It also isolates the Islamic community and subjects them to prejudice and (undeserved) ill treatment. This can be used to help recruit the next round of terrorists.

If one cell is captured, the next cell will claim that the people arrested are innocents who are being oppressed because the are Muslim, and that this killing demonstrates that they have the wrong people. This introduces doubt that can be used by the defense to defend them (using the justice system against itself, and making convictions more difficult).

One big advantage of this is that it is cheap, and the money will last a long time. The terrorists move around to force as many police agencies as possible to get involved, increasing the profile of the hunt.

Things that go boom ‚Ä¢ June 16, 2006 10:30 AM

There are a number of oil refineries along the California coast, many located next to residential areas. Drive a truckload of explosives into a tank of LP gas for a very big boom. This probably wouldn’t kill a large number of people, but there would be a large amount of damage (due to broken glass, etc) and a large fear factor. This is fairly cheap and easy to do.

Alternatively, blow up a HF acid tank to release a toxic cloud. This is more difficult today than it was 10 years ago because hydrogen fluoride use has been banned or restricted in many cities due to safety concerns.

At the more difficult end of things, blow up a tanker full of methyl isocyanate or some other cyanide compound. Although this would be certainly be effective, availability of methyl isocyanate would be a problem. Since the Bhopal disaster, nobody wants to keep this stuff around. But for $500000 it might be possible to build a lab to synthesize a large quantity, and then steal a truck to deliver it.

I like this one because it plays on fear rather than actual harm.

Plotline :
Terrorists visit 40-50 major US cities and at night strap innocuous grey metal boxes to lamp posts near government buildings. The boxes are about the size of a shoebox and securely fastened at about 10-12 feet from the ground.

The terrorists then deliver video recordings of their leader or known henchmen to Al-Jazeera claiming that “the wrath of Allah” will descend on the US and that the locations of the devastation have been marked with clocks. He holds one to the camera (one of the boxes which have been distributed in the US earlier) and lifts the lid off the front, revealing a large red LED clock ticking down.

This tape is duly played on Al-Jazeera. Word spreads quickly. Every news network in the world starts replaying the threat. People start discovering the boxes in their city with numbers ticking down from 48 hours. The authorities try to surreptitiously remove them, but it’s difficult to surreptitiously remove something 10-12 feet off the ground without “someone” noticing.

Fear spreads. 10’s of millions of citizens try to leave every major city. Hundreds if not thousands would die in the mayhem. Huge government money and resources would be spent evacuating the sick and elderly. The economy would be severely disrupted as millions stayed away from work. Looting would be rampant. Some politicians would urge caution, some would run off at the mouth. Law and order would effectively break down.

The boxes tick down to zero and… nothing happens.

The terrorists can then release one of two pre-prepared tapes saying either A) There was a technical malfunction and it will all be triggered shortly or B) The “Wrath of Allah” was the fear in the hearts of the infidels and the destruction they wrought upon themselves was brought about by Allah’s will.

Either way many politician’s careers will be over and it would take days or weeks for things to get back to normal.

Jimbo ‚Ä¢ June 22, 2006 9:16 PM

Bruce, Bruce, Bruce…….your winning entry is so implausible, I am surprised that you give it serious thought.

First, it would be virtually impossible for attackers to take over two separate UPS terminals at two separate airports, AND KEEP THAT FACT A SECRET until the planes reached their destination. Once somebody noticed what was going on, the plot would be foiled. So that means capturing or killing every employee at each site quietly enough so as to not raise the alarm. Airports are busy places especially the air cargo areas at night. It would be virtually impossible for terrorists to secure these sites in secret.

Second, air traffic controllers would certainly notice UPS aircraft taking off far ahead of their normal schedule. If the attackers waited for the normal schedule, the risk of the plot being discovered would increase.

Third, the plot requires the airliners to fly low enough to be below radar, but the terrain between the airports and the target is some of the most mountainous terrain in North America. It would be virtually impossible for large jet aircraft traveling at high speed to hug the ground in such terrain at night.

Finally, although it seems quite large, the Dam is quite a difficult target to hit with an aircraft traveling at nearly 200 mph (large jet aircraft can’t fly much slower than that). The World Trade Center towers were much easier to hit because they’re so tall and visible from such a great distance on a clear sunny day. While nearly a mile wide, the Grand Coulee Dam is only about 300 feet tall (above the water line). You would have to be an incredible pilot and also quite lucky to hit such a small target at that speed at night.

While imaginative, this plot lacks all realism. I would have chosen a more realistic plot.

Fred Heutte ‚Ä¢ July 1, 2006 9:56 PM

From the winning entry: “No warning is given to the dams downriver, other than the generation at G.C. is now offline.” Not at all likely. Ask the Bonneville Power Administration and the Corps of Engineers and Bureau of Reclamation, who actually run most of the dams on the Columbia mainstem, about the SCADA systems for integrating the grid and about the extensive flow monitoring on the river. There are security provisions which aren’t and should not be public, but in general, our regional grid is perhaps the best engineered in the world, and even a massive failure at Grand Coulee would be isolated and “islanded” within less than a second. There are always enough “spinning reserves” on the system to provide reliability throughout the grid. This does not rule out an occasional cascading failure as occurred in 1995 when a tree limb shorted out a transmission line in central Oregon and did shut down much of the west coast for a brief period. System outages occur daily — see for example the logs at http://www.transmission.bpa.gov/orgs/opi/outages/DIR/TODAY.HTM. Downstream dams have enough storage capacity to hold even a flood surge from Grand Coulee. Of course, any major infrastructure like the Northwest power system is a potential target, but frankly I worry a lot more about ammonia on railcars and things like that which are ubiquitous and not at all well monitored. The plot for your winner is a pageturner, I guess, but any system planner or engineer knows it’s only good enough for a bad TV movie.

SANSy-44771 ‚Ä¢ October 18, 2006 8:52 AM

While flying on American Airlines last week, I watched the flight attendant move a beverage cart into the middle of the walkway and wedge it in front of the bathroom near the cockpit as a barricade. She then knocked on the cockpit door, a pilot came out and went to the bathroom. After the pilot came out of the bathroom, he immediately knocked on the cockpit door, it opened, and he went back in.

Strategy: For the attackers with first-class aisle seats in the front, the beverage cart being wedged into the walkway is the sign that the cockpit door will soon be opened. When it is opened, have one man dive over the beverage cart and scramble to put his body into the cockpit doorway to keep it open, have another couple guys jump over the cart and get into the cockpit with knives hidden in the opaque-to-x-ray batteries of their laptops, etc. (or with their hair gel containers and nail clippers).

A variation of this is to watch the light coming through the spyhole in the cockpit door: when it goes dark, a pilot is looking through it to check out the walkway, most likely because he’s about to open the door to go to the bathroom. This gives time for the attackers to prepare while the attendant moves the beverage cart, or, if the cart trick wont be used at all, to get ready to rush the door upon opening.

Because it is unlikely that the pilot coming out of the bathroom will wait a random amount of time before going back into the cockpit, his emerging from the bathroom could also be used as the signal to rush the front, since he will likely just immediately knock on the cockpit door. But this isn’t as effective of course (if only because the recently-pottied pilot is now in the open and able to fight instead of being indisposed in the commode, which, by the way, could be held shut by an attacker as a simple way to neutralize that pilot when the fight starts).

The beverage cart is intended to be a barrier, but it is much more useful to the attackers as a signal that the door will soon be opened. It would be better if the pilot just quickly opened the cockpit door at an unpredictable time, locked it behind him, helped to move the beverage cart into barrier position, pottied while the flight attendant braced the cart and watched for rushers, pilot emerges and waits a random amount of time (30 seconds to 3 minutes) then regains access to cockpit again after confirming no attack. Assuming a little piece of plastic is always hung over the spyhole inside the cockpit to block light, the pilot could put his eye up to the spyhole, move the plastic aside to see into the walkway while continuing to block light with his head, then the pilot could view the walkway before opening the door without signalling with the light that he was about to do so.

RayCeeYa ‚Ä¢ April 3, 2007 1:44 AM

OK this is pure genius. You’ll need about a thousand people in on this. You are going to need a hell of a collection of old cars. The reason is you need to have cars that have engines that predate electronic ignition. What you do with these cars is remove the condenser from the ignition system, and drive them around a major metropolitan area, say Manhattan.

These older ignition systems use what are called breaker points. Without the condenser to muffle the spark arcing across the points the ignition system the breaker points will act like a spark gap transmitter. Spark gap transmitters aren’t tuned to any particular frequency, so the end result is a broad range of radio interference.

Multiplied by several thousand cars you have enough energy to wipe out most digital communication in a small area, or you can drive them around and wreak havoc with cell phones, wi-fi even civilian and police band radios.

Movie Terror Plot:

The Premise: Illegal immigrants infiltrate the US and take down planes with portable DVD players and prescription glasses.

Scene 1: 30 foreign nationals sneak across both the Canadian and the Mexican border. Special camera time is spent on the absence of miles of electrified fencing and the absence of border patrol guards. (One of the “Minutemen” spots them and calls in border patrol. They arrive 3 hours too late.)

Scene 2: The illegal immigrants get hired by companies either by using badly forged paper-work. (Cue scene with them gloating over the lack of REAL ID that allows them to so easily get away with it.)

Scene 3: After working in these companies and gaining a large group of people that will all claim “He was always so quiet. How could he ever do such a thing?” when the time comes, their corporate health-insurance becomes valid. They all go out to get eye exams.

Scene 4: Cut to scene with illegal immigrants tampering with and forging their lens prescriptions. (Of course, the lack of proper security paper helps this.) Careful work with college optics text-books allow them to carefully craft the exact prescriptions that they need.

Scene 5: Each terrorist goes out to their local electronics store and purchases a portable DVD player.

Scene 6: Airport security (finally!) 30 illegal immigrants with forged identification go through security with coke-bottle glasses and portable DVD players. Their shoes are carefully inspected to ensure that they aren’t explosive. They get through with no problems and board 3 different airplanes (10 per plane)

Scene 7: On each plane, the terrorists wait until they are at cruising altitude and then disassemble the DVD players to get at the lasers. They focus them using the glasses to blind the various flight attendants. When the co-pilot goes to look through the cockpit door viewport, they blind him as well.

Scene 8: All of the 10 lasers are focused together (using the glasses) to create a beam strong enough to cut through the cockpit door. Once inside, they blind the pilot and hijack the plane.

Scene 9: The terrorists all crash their planes into border-patrol headquarters to make it easier for their brethren to sneak in.

Few final notes:
Cost is ($100 (DVD player) + $1000 (Human Smuggler) + $300 (plane ticket)) * 30 (people) = $42,000
DVD player lasers output around 5-10mw (sufficient for eye damage) so if you get your lenses right, 100mw (10 of them) is sufficient to cut through things.

Clearly, the TSA must ban all optical drives and all corrective lenses. (Not to mention beef up REAL ID, border security, control on illegal immigrants, and dispensing medical devices without a valid prescription.)

HijACKING the data link
or
Overiding the airplanes GPS information through a distrbuted Nintendo DS network using the Motorola chipset and TDMA protocol to exploit the ADS-B system.

The scenario:
Terrorist hire electronics engineers to study the relationship between the Nintendo DS’, Motorola chipset, and the ADS-B technology used to broadcast aircraft positions. They purchase a small aircraft containing an ADS-B system and 5 Nintendo DS units. After 17 months of work they finally find an exploitable correlation in the TDMA protocol that allows the Nintendo to run homebrew code that can spoof the ADS-B information being brodcast. The homebrew code is then loaded into 30 “special” Nintendo DS systems and distributed out to the terrorist network. After several more months these systems finally arrive in the hands of the terrorist who then distribute the systems free of charge to unsuspecting passengers. The systems, now having been synchronized with each passengers flight information, just need to be activated. As long as the Nintendo DS is turned on within 50 feet of the ADS-B equipment on board the plane, it will hijack the aircrafts own ADS-B signal being broadcast, replacing the true signal information with information that will eventually lead to the collision of 15 planes with 15 other planes. The tainted Nintedo DS units are all activated within 15 minutes of each flight, all 30 Nintendo’s begin running the prepopulated exploit code, spoofing the information to the ADS-B system. The estatic recipients of the “awards” are blissfully unaware that each Mario jump, each Kirby punch, each pet of their Nintendog is leading their very flight on a ride to disaster. As the Nintendo DS transmitter, being capable of sending proprietary TDMA information using the Motorola based chipset silently works as programmed in 80% of the cases, causing a mid-air collision of 24 planes almost simultaneously so there is no chance to respond, react or recall the aircraft. Once again air travel in the United States takes a huge blow, with massive disruptions to the economy and investigators are puzzled for months until they figure out what caused the disasters. Then to the great ire of Nintendo fanboys everywhere, the TSA issues the ban on all Nintendo handheld gaming devices, until the problem can be studied further. This action in turn results in even larger financial burdens on the already cash strapped airlines as 10’s of thousands of distraught parents refuse to fly anymore as their children have nothing to do on the airplane. Amtrak’s business increases marginally. Nintendo releases a patch for the DS one month later.

TSO ‚Ä¢ May 31, 2007 3:42 PM

“Snake balloons”.

Bad guys purchase a large amount of helium canisters, transparent balloons, and fishing-line. A hundred of helium-inflated balloons is attached to a single fishing line, say, one balloon every 5-10 feet. Thousands of such contraptions are released into the atmosphere to float freely and at random at attitudes of about 30000 feet, where strong winds blow.

Terror points:
* such contraptions are endangering the airplanes, as they’re next to impossible to detect both on the radars and visually, and hard to avoid at high speeds, since the detection distance is very low.
* they cannot be easily destroyed (shooting a few balloons out of a hundred in the chain just causes the contraption to drop a little lower, but does not kill it), and they cannot be individually targeted, because no airplane can flow slowly enough to aim at such small targets at high altitudes.
* they can carry dangerous payloads (a few pounds per contraption), such as biological agents, or even simple explosives (say, hand grenades) that get released once they happen to fly over pre-programmed target areas, as determined by a small and light GPS receiver in the payload.

About Bruce Schneier

I am a public-interest technologist, working at the intersection of security, technology, and people. I've been writing about security issues on my blog since 2004, and in my monthly newsletter since 1998. I'm a fellow and lecturer at Harvard's Kennedy School, a board member of EFF, and the Chief of Security Architecture at Inrupt, Inc. This personal website expresses the opinions of none of those organizations.
